result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicklaus J. Copus

records.addlTxt:
$50.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
--Spring Copus, 932 S. 20th Street, Manitowoc, WI  54220.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:41 AM  - Defendant Nicklaus J. Copus appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Carl Knepel appearing, by zoom, for the defendant.  Defendant needs to complete PD application before they officially represent him.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant needs a copy of the complaint.   Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.    Initial appearance is reset to 09-01-22 at 10:30 a.m.   
Minutes.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of entry into locked vehicle, attempted theft, bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-25-22 at 10:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $50.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant is to have no contact with M.A.S., DOB: 03-22-1967 or the residence of 1815 Michigan Avenue, Manitowoc, WI  54220.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 08-19-2022
